episodes.title: Epstein Files: Ex-Prince Andrew Arrested | Bill Gates Skips Delhi AI Summit | Rift In INDIA Bloc?
episodes.description:
The global fallout from the Jeffrey Epstein files has reached a historic turning point with the arrest of former British royal Prince Andrew by Thames Valley Police on charges of misconduct in public office. The arrest, described as a 'seismic moment' in modern history, follows revelations of his alleged ties to the late sex offender. Simultaneously, the scandal has impacted high-profile events in India, where Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates withdrew from a scheduled keynote address at the India AI Impact Summit in Delhi. The transcript highlights a 'reckoning for the global elite,' noting high-level resignations across the US, UAE, and Europe, including DP World CEO Sultan Ahmed bin Salaim and Goldman Sachs Chief Legal Officer Kathy Romer. In India, the files have brought scrutiny to Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and industrialist Anil Ambani regarding their past interactions with Epstein. While no legal culpability has been established for the Indian figures, the report questions the 'code of silence' surrounding their mentions in the documents.

episodes.title: Ex-Prince Andrew Arrested Over Epstein Files Fallout | Former BBC Editor Naresh Kaushik Exclusive
episodes.description:
Former BBC Editor Naresh Kaushik joins India Today's 'Five Live' to discuss the 'unprecedented' arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly Prince Andrew. UK police took the royal into custody on 19 February 2026, at the Sandringham estate. Unlike previous allegations, this arrest stems from suspected 'misconduct in public office' related to sharing sensitive government data with Jeffrey Epstein during his tenure as a trade envoy. Kaushik describes the event as a 'stark' fall from grace for King Charles' brother, noting the Royal Family is under immense pressure. The discussion highlights that Andrew is being treated as a 'regular civilian' following the stripping of his royal titles. The segment also connects the global fallout of the Epstein files to India, noting Bill Gates' last-minute withdrawal from the India AI Impact Summit after his name featured in the documents. Kaushik suggests this arrest may be the 'tip of the iceberg', with other high-profile figures like Peter Mandelson potentially facing scrutiny.

episodes.title: Hardeep Singh Puri Exclusive Over Rahul's Epstein Files Allegations | Rahul Vs Puri | India Today
episodes.description:
In an exclusive interview with India Today, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri lashed out at Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, describing his conduct in Parliament as 'buffoonery' and 'politics by innuendo'. Addressing allegations regarding his name appearing in the Jeffrey Epstein files, Puri clarified that his brief interactions with Epstein occurred between 2013 and 2014 as part of an official delegation for the Independent Commission on Multilateralism (ICM). He stated, 'I did not meet him on my own volition; I went to him as part of my work.' Puri revealed he had sent a detailed note to Gandhi in November 2025 explaining these facts after a 'winking' encounter in Parliament, yet the Congress leader chose to raise the issue on the floor. The Minister further defended India's trade deals, dismissing claims of 'surrender' to the US as nonsensical. He also addressed past social media attacks by TMC MP Mahua Moitra, suggesting that those attempting to 'milk' the controversy would face 'systemic retribution'.

episodes.title: Rahul Gandhi Slams Govt Over Adani & Epstein Files; Claims PM Is Being 'Choked' | Lok Sabha Budget
episodes.description:
Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi launched a scathing attack on the government during the Budget debate in the Lok Sabha, alleging that the Prime Minister has 'sold India' because he is being 'choked' by powerful interests. Gandhi specifically targeted businessman Gautam Adani, claiming that the ongoing legal case in the United States is actually 'targeted to the Prime Minister of India' and the BJP's financial architecture. He further stirred controversy by mentioning the 'Epstein files', questioning why certain individuals are not in jail and asking who introduced them to Jeffrey Epstein. The speech faced heavy interruptions from the Chair and BJP's Ravi Shankar Prasad, who cited Rule 352 and 353, arguing that Gandhi was making 'wild allegations' against high authorities and ministers without substantive motions or prior notice. Gandhi also took a personal swipe at the presiding officer, calling him an 'ex-Congress member' whose 'heart is still here', while maintaining that the defense budget is being influenced by corporate interests.

episodes.title: Donald Trump Under Fire For Calling Jeffrey Epstein Files 'Boring' And 'Sordid' In Special Report
episodes.description:
On this Special Report, the focus is on the controversy surrounding US President Donald Trump and the unreleased Jeffrey Epstein files. Despite a 2024 campaign promise to release all documents, Trump has faced criticism from his own supporters for the delay. The programme highlights a damning Wall Street Journal report alleging a leaked birthday message from Trump to Epstein, which Trump has denied, reportedly filing a $10 billion libel suit in response. Addressing the fascination with the case, Trump stated, 'He's dead for a long time. He was never a big factor in terms of life... It's pretty boring stuff.'

episodes.description:
LIVE: King Charles Strips Andrew Of Royal Titles  | LIVE From Windsor | Royal Family News 
King Charles III has stripped Prince Andrew of all remaining royal titles, honours, and his Windsor residence amid renewed scrutiny over his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
